description: builds a new release from a designated starting point and optionally creates PR in Github

flags.startFromNpmDistTag: the npm dist-tag to start the release from, examples: nightly, latest-rc
flags.startFromGithubRef: a Github ref to start the release from, examples: main, 7.144.0, f476e8e
flags.releaseChannel: the channel intended for this release, examples: nightly, latest-rc, latest, dev, beta, etc...
flags.resolutions: bump the versions of packages listed in the resolutions section
flags.pinnedDeps: bump the versions of the packages listed in the pinnedDependencies section
flags.jit: bump the versions of the packages listed in the jitPlugins (just-in-time) section
flags.label: add one or more labels to the Github PR
flags.only: only bump the version of the packages passed in, uses latest if version is not provided
flags.patch: bump the release as a patch of an existing version, not a new minor version
flags.buildOnly: only build the release, do not git add/commit/push
